paste:TC7IhJL.value:
{"id":"TC7IhJL","content":"Act as an automated grader for the Pastebin-Lite take-home assignment.

Review this entire project and verify it strictly matches the assessment specification.

Check all of the following:

1. Required API routes
   - GET /api/healthz returns HTTP 200 and valid JSON { "ok": true }
   - Verifies persistence layer connectivity
   - Correct Content-Type and fast response

2. Paste creation
   - POST /api/pastes validates input correctly
   - content is required and non-empty
   - ttl_seconds and max_views are optional integers >= 1
   - Returns 2xx with JSON containing valid id and URL pointing to /p/:id
   - Invalid input returns proper 4xx JSON errors

3. Paste retrieval (API)
   - GET /api/pastes/:id returns content, remaining_views, expires_at
   - Each successful fetch counts as a view
   - remaining_views never becomes negative
   - Returns 404 for missing, expired, or view-limit-exceeded pastes
   - Uses x-test-now-ms header as current time when present, otherwise system time
   - Combined constraints: paste becomes unavailable when the first constraint triggers

4. HTML paste view
   - GET /p/:id returns HTTP 200 with HTML containing paste content
   - Content is rendered safely (no script execution)
   - Returns HTTP 404 when paste is unavailable

5. Persistence & serverless safety
   - Uses persistent storage (Redis/KV/Postgres/etc.), not in-memory
   - Safe for Vercel/serverless execution
   - No global mutable state shared across requests

6. Error handling & robustness
   - Consistent 404 for unavailable pastes
   - No serving pastes beyond TTL or view limits
   - Handles small concurrent access correctly

7. Repository & README checks
   - README.md exists at repo root
   - README includes:
     - Project description
     - Local run instructions
     - Persistence layer explanation
     - Important design decisions
   - No hardcoded localhost URLs
   - No secrets, tokens, or credentials committed
   - Project installs and runs using documented commands

After review:
- List any mismatches, missing requirements, or test-failing risks
- Clearly state a final verdict: PASS, PASS WITH RISKS, or FAIL
- Suggest minimal fixes if needed","createdAt":1766999586134,"expiresAt":1766999646134,"remainingViews":null}
